data.meta_site_name: The Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and Museum
data.text:
HENRY J. TAYLOR PAPERS, 1908-1984

5 linear feet, 8 linear inches (13 LGA-S boxes)

Herbert Hoover Presidential Library

BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE

Sep 2, 1902 Born in Chicago, Illinois.

1924 Graduated from the University of Virginia.

March 2, 1928 Married Oliva Fay Kimbro: 1 son, Henry Noble Taylor

1941-1945 Foreign correspondent for Scripps-Howard Newspaper Syndicate.

1945-1956 Speaker on General Motors radio program "Your Land and Mine".

1957-1961 United States Ambassador to Switzerland

1961-1981 Columnist for United Features Syndicate.

July 3, 1970 Married Marion J. E. Richardson.

1984 Feb 24 Died in New York City.

Scope and Content Note

Henry J. Taylor was an economist, journalist, author and ambassador. This is a collection of his radio talks, 1945‑56, his United Feature articles written for Scripps‑Howard Newspaper Syndicate, 1961‑June 1981; and holograph and typed letters signed by various leaders and prominent persons in industry, business, international affairs, government, education, the military, religion, news media, entertainment, etc. The papers are arranged in chorological order by name and subject.

FOLDER LIST
